entry.title: WindEdit - 10Gb Huge File
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindEdit can open very huge file with a little memory.

Huge File

For example: Open 10Gb huge file only cost 35MB memory.

Test platform: windows 10 - 2.3 GHz Intel Core i5 and 8GB memory and ssd.

10Gb
elapsed 19.72s
memory (before) 19.1MB
memory (after) 55.0MB

entry.title: WindEdit - 50,000,000 Lines File
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindEdit can open a huge file contains millions of lines.

Millions Of Lines

For example: Open 50,000,000 lines file contains numbers only cost 27MB memory.

Test platform: windows 10 - 2.3 GHz Intel Core i5 and 8GB memory and ssd.

50,000,000 lines, 466MB
elapsed 1.68s
memory (before) 19.2MB
memory (after) 46.0MB

entry.title: WindEdit - 400Mb Long Line File
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindEdit can open a huge file contains only one line.

One Line Huge File

For example: Open 400MB one line huge file only cost 14MB memory.

Test platform: windows 10 - 2.3 GHz Intel Core i5 and 8GB memory and ssd.

one line, 400MB
elapsed 0.95s
memory (before) 19.2MB
memory (after) 33.6MB

entry.title: WindTerm - AddressBar / Existing Host
entry.content:
Quick Start

Addressbar supports to choose “Switch to tab” to activate the tab when the host has been opened.

Existing Host

entry.title: WindTerm - AddressBar / Button Menu
entry.content:
Quick Start

When clicking the button, the corresponding session list will pop up:

  • Session button: List sessions in the same group
  • Group button: List sessions in the same group level
  • Protocol button: List sessions in the same protocol
  • Root button: List all sessions

Button Menu

entry.title: WindTerm - AddressBar / Non-existing Host
entry.content:
Quick Start

Addressbar supports to open host address in the format “protocol://host:port”. When the protocol name or port is omitted, ssh and 22 is used by default.

Non-Existing Host

entry.title: WindTerm - AddressBar / Property Panel
entry.content:
Quick Start

Clicking the button in the address bar will display current session’s property.

Property Panel

entry.title: WindTerm - Auto Login
entry.content:
Quick Start

Auto login of SSH password based authentication is supported. Please follow the below steps:

  • Check “Remember this host” in the user page of login wizard.
  • Check “Auto login next time” in the password page of login wizard.
  • Input and confirm the master password for the first time. Keep master password empty to disable it.
  • Click “Continue” button to connect host.

The session will auto login next time, and the master password will be required only once when WindTerm is newly launched.

Auto Login

entry.title: WindTerm - AddressBar / Text Selection
entry.content:
Quick Start

When you double click a button, the text of the button and the buttons after it will be selected by default to facilitate copying or modification.

Text Selection

entry.title: WindTerm - Command Palette / Execute Actions
entry.content:
Quick Start

Command palette supports executing the internal actions.

Shortcut
Alt+S, >
Alt+;

Execute Actions

entry.title: WindTerm - Command Palette / Calculator
entry.content:
Quick Start

Command palette supports calculator functions.

Shortcut
Alt+S, =

Calculator

Properties

  • Value Properties
    E
    LN10
    LN2
    LOG2E
    LOG10E
    PI
    SQRT1_2
    SQRT2

  • Function Properties
    abs(x)
    acos(x)
    acosh(x)
    asin(x)
    asinh(x)
    atan(x)
    atanh(x)
    atan2(y, x)
    cbrt(x)
    ceil(x)
    clz32(x)
    cos(x)
    cosh(x)
    exp(x)
    expm1(x)
    floor(x)
    fround(x)
    hypot(x, y)
    imul(x, y)
    log(x)
    log10(x)
    log1p(x)
    log2(x)
    max([value1 [, value2 [, …]]])
    min([value1 [, value2 [, …]]])
    pow(x, y)
    random()
    round(x)
    sign(x)
    sin(x)
    sinh(x)
    sqrt(x)
    tan(x)
    tanh(x)
    trunc(x)

entry.title: WindTerm - Command Palette / Goto Symbol
entry.content:
Quick Start

Command palette supports filtering and jumping to symbol.

Shortcut
Alt+S, @
Alt+’

Goto Symbol

entry.title: WindTerm - Command Palette / Open Session
entry.content:
Quick Start

Command palette supports filtering and opening sessions. The blue icon means to switch to the opened session.

Shortcut
Alt+S, tm, Space
Alt+O

Opne Session

entry.title: WindTerm - Command Palette / Goto Line
entry.content:
Quick Start

Command palette supports filtering and jumping to line. Use +, - to jump to the relative line.

Shortcut
Alt+S, :
Alt+G

Goto Line

entry.title: WindTerm - Highlight
entry.content:
Quick Start

Four highlight types are supported now. The highligh config syntax is compatible with vscode and fully extensible.

  • linux: Linux system highlight.
  • cmd: Windows cmd highlight.
  • powershell: Windows powershell highlight.
  • none: No highlight.

Highlight

entry.title: WindTerm - Auto wrap
entry.content:
Quick Start

Content in view can be auto wrapped by char or word at the window border or specified columns.

Auto wrap

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Copy And Paste Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

In local mode, one can copy with y{motion}, where {motion} is a navigation motion or searching motion. For example, yw copies to the beginning of the next word. Other helpful copy commands include:

  • yy
    Copy the current line, including the newline character
  • y$
    Copy to the end of the current line without the newline character
  • yw
    Copy to the beginning of the next word
  • ytx
    Copy from the current cursor position up to and before the character x
  • yfx
    Copy from the current cursor position up to and including the character x
Shortcut Action
yy Copy the current selection or line
p Paste and switch back to remote mode
P Paste and stay in local mode
“xy{motion} Copy into the register x
“xp Paste contents of the register x and switch to remote mode
“xP Paste contents of the register x and stay in local mode
“+y{motion} Copy into the system clipboard register
“+p Paste from the system clipboard register and switch to remote mode
“+P Paste from the system clipboard register and stay in local mode

Copy And Paste Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Remote Mode And Local Mode
entry.content:
Quick Start

There are two modes in WindTerm:

  • Remote Mode
    The remote mode is the default mode of WindTerm. In remote mode, every key pressed will sends to the server just like the other terminals.

  • Local Mode
    The local mode is mainly used for browsing the text. In local mode, every key pressed will be parsed locally instead of being sent to the server.

    The local mode supports most navigation, scrolling, searching, copy and paste, selection and folding shortcuts of Vim.

    When WindTerm in local mode, it just acts like a readonly text editor, which is very convenient for text browsing. In particular, when the output is scrolling quickly and continuously, switching to the local mode can immediately stop scrolling for easy reading of the output.

Shortcut Action
Shift+Enter Toggle the remote and local mode
i Switch back to remote mode from local mode
p Paste and switch back to remote mode from local mode
Ctrl+v Paste and switch back to remote mode from local mode

Remote Mode And Local Mode

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Navigation Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

Local mode supports the following navigation keys of Vim.

Shortcut Action
h Move left
j Move down
k Move up
l Move right
0 Move to the begining of the line
$ Move to the end of the line
^ Move to the first non-blank character of the line
w Move to next word
W Move to next blank delimited word
b Move to the beginning of the word
B Move to the beginning of the blank delimted word
e Move to the end of the word
E Move to the end of the blank delimited word
1G Move to the first line of the session
nG Move to nth line of the session
G Move to the last line of the session
gg move to the beginning of the session
ge Move to the end of the previous word
gE Move to the end of the previous Blank delimited word
- Move to the previous non-blank sentence
+ Move to the next non-blank sentence
( Move to the previous sentence
) Move to the next sentence
{ Move to the previous paragraph
} Move to the next paragraph

Navigation Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Folding Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

Local mode supports the following folding keys of Vim.

Shortcut Action
zj Move down to top of the next fold
zk Move up to bottom of the previous fold
za Toggle the current fold
zo Open the current fold
zc Close the current fold
zO Open the current fold recursively
zC Close the current fold recursively
zm Close all folds
zM Close all folds
zr Open all folds
zR Open all folds

Folding Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - Fold
entry.content:
Quick Start

Every command and its output can be folded. Fold supports the below actions:

  • Fold/Unfold current command (Mouse LButton Click)
  • Fold/Unfold all commands (Alt + Mouse LButton Click)
  • Select Fold Range Text (Mouse LButton Double Click)

Fold

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Searching Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

Local mode supports the following searching keys of Vim.

Shortcut Action
/ Open the search bar
fc Move to the next c on the current line after the cursor
Fc Move to the next c on the current line before the cursor
tc Move to before the next c on the current line after the cursor
Tc Move to before the next c on the current line before the cursor
; Repeat last f, t, F or T
, Repeat last f, t, F or T in opposite direction

Searching Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Scrolling Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

Local mode supports the following scrolling keys of Vim.

Shortcut Action
H Move to the top line of screen
M Move to the center line of screen
L Move to the bottom line of screen
zt Move the cursor line to the top of screen
zz Move the cursor line to the center of screen
zb Move the cursor line to the bottom of screen
Ctrl+e Scroll down one line
Ctrl+y Scroll up one line
Ctrl+d Scroll down half a screen
Ctrl+u Scroll up half a screen
Ctrl+b Scroll up a screen

Scrolling Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - Keyboard / Local Mode / Selection Keys
entry.content:
Quick Start

In local mode, one can select text with v{motion} or V{motion}, where {motion} is a navigation motion or searching motion. For example, vw selects to the beginning of the next word. Other helpful copy commands include:

  • v$
    Select to the end of the current line without the newline character
  • vw
    Select to the beginning of the next word
  • vtx
    Select from the current cursor position up to and before the character x
  • vfx
    Select from the current cursor position up to and including the character x
Shortcut Action
v{motion} Select text
V{motion} Select text

Selection Keys

entry.title: WindTerm - New Session
entry.content:
Quick Start

Click “New Session” on menu or toolbar to create new session.

Sessions

WindTerm supports four session types now.

  • SSH
  • Telnet
  • Shell (Cmd, Powershell)
  • Serial

entry.title: WindTerm - Manage Sessions
entry.content:
Quick Start

Use shortcut menu in Session Tree to manage sessions.

Management

Five types of session management are supported now.

  • Label
  • Group
  • Delete
  • Property
  • Filter

entry.title: WindTerm - Outline
entry.content:
Quick Start

Outline is usually used to collect every command typed and make these commands easier to browser and filter.

Outline

entry.title: WindTerm - Outline / Copy
entry.content:
Quick Start

Outline supports copying the name or output of a single or multiple command nodes.

Outline

entry.title: WindTerm - Outline / Preview
entry.content:
Quick Start

When the mouse hovers over the command node, the preview pane will be displayed to facilitate reading the command output.

Outline

entry.title: WindTerm - Reopen session
entry.content:
Quick Start

The closed session can be reopened by Recent menu or shortcut.

  • Close current session. (Ctrl+Shift+W)
  • Reopen closed session. (Ctrl+Shift+T)

Restore Sessions

entry.title: WindTerm - Outline / Execution
entry.content:
Quick Start

Outline supports re-execution or repeated execution of the selected single or multiple commands. And you can quickly execute the commands by double-clicking or the context menu.

Outline

entry.title: WindTerm - Restore Sessions
entry.content:
Quick Start

All last sessions will be restored after restart, and the session only connects to target when its view is actived.

Restore Sessions

entry.title: WindTerm - Preview Window
entry.content:
Quick Start

The content can be previewed when mouse hovers on the scrollbar.

Preview Window

entry.title: WindTerm - Pair
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports highlighting the opening and closing delimiter ((), [], {} and any customed delimiters) when you set caret in its pair. And you can quickly select the matching pairs by double-clicking or using shortcuts.

Shortcut Action
Ctrl+Shift+[ Select the matching pairs.
Repeating the key will expands the selection to the outer matching pairs.
Ctrl+Shift+] Same as above
Alt+Shift+[ Select to the opening delimiter
Alt+Shift+] Select to the closing delimiter

Pair

entry.title: WindTerm - Search And Mark
entry.content:
Quick Start

The content can be searched and all instances of the current word will be marked.

Search and mark

  • Open search pane (Alt+F)
  • Close search pane (Esc)

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Add And Remove Sender
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sender pane supports multiple senders to send simultaneously.

Add And Remove Sender

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Send Hex Data
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sender pane supports sending hex data by blocks or chars at specified intervals. The minimum interval is 0.1s(by blocks) or 20ms(by chars).

Send Hex Data

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Send Chars
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sender pane supports sending text char by char at specified intervals. The minimum interval is 20ms.

Send Chars

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Select Targets
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sender pane supports selecting the target sessions to be sent, including all sessions, the current session and the selected sessions.

Select Targets

entry.title: WindTerm - Split Window
entry.content:
Quick Start

Use Window menu or toolbar to split window.

Split window

Window can be splitted by:

  • Split View Horizontally (Alt+W, Alt+H)
  • Split View Vertically (Alt+W, Alt+V)
  • Split Group Horizontally
  • Split Group Vertically

Navigate in views:

  • Activate Next View (Alt+[)
  • Activate Previous View (Alt+])

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Send Text
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sender pane supports sending text line by line at specified intervals. The minimum interval is 0.1s.

Send Text

entry.title: WindTerm - Tabbar / Duplicate Tab
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports duplicating the session tab.

Duplicate Tab

entry.title: WindTerm - Tabbar / Split Tab
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports splitting the session tab horizontally and vertically.

Split Tab

entry.title: WindTerm - Tabbar / Rename Tab
entry.content:
Quick Start

Supports to change the tab name through the shortcut menu of the session tab.

Rename Tab

entry.title: WindTerm - Sender Pane / Keyboard Shortcuts
entry.content:
Quick Start

Shortcut Action
Alt+Enter Send
Alt+Q Stop
Alt+= Add Sender
Alt+- Remove Sender
Alt+X Clear Sender

entry.title: WindTerm - Tips / Input By Dragging And Dropping Text
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports fast input by dragging and dropping text selected internally or text selected in an external programs.

Input By Dragging And Dropping Text

entry.title: WindTerm - Tips / Goto The Previous/Next Prompt Line
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports going to the previous/next prompt line, which makes it very convenient to read the output of each command.

Shortcut [Remote Mode] Action
Ctrl+Shift+Left Goto the previous prompt line
Ctrl+Shift+Right Goto the next prompt line
Shortcut [Local Mode] Action
zk Goto the previous prompt line
zj Goto the next prompt line

Goto The Previous/Next Prompt Line

entry.title: WindTerm - Tips / Text Selection
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports selecting different parts of the text by clicking on the separator boundary. This is very convenient for selecting a path or URL.

Text Selection

entry.title: WindTerm - Toggle Margin
entry.content:
Quick Start

Margins can be shown or hidden by View menu or shortcuts.

Margins

Five margin types are supported now:

  • Line number (Alt+T, Alt+N)
  • Timestamp (Alt+T, Alt+T)
  • Fold (Alt+T, Alt+F)
  • Symbol (Alt+T, Alt+S)
  • Blank (Alt+T, Alt+B)

entry.title: WindTerm - Tips / Restore Tabs
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm supports restoring recently closed tabs.

Shortcut Action
Ctrl+Shift+W Close tab
Ctrl+Shift+T Restore tab

Restore Tabs

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Benchmark
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer has very fast upload and download speed for huge files and many small files.

Benchmark

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Create Folder/File/Link
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports creating a new folder/file/link in the current folder, and you can set whether to automatically open it after the directory or file is created.

Create Folder/File/Link

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Paste To Terminal
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports pasting the names or paths of multiple folders or files to the current session.

Paste To Terminal

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Download
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports downloading multiple folders or files from the host.

Download

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Move To
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports moving multiple folders or files from one folder to another.

Move To

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Filter Items
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports filtering items in the current folder. You can freely input and filter at any time.

Filter Items

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Property
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports viewing the property of a folder or file.

Property

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Rename
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports renaming a folder or file.

Rename

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Removing
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports removing multiple folders and files.

Removing

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Upload
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports uploading multiple folders or files to the host.

Upload

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Open With Default Editor
entry.content:
Quick Start

Sftp transfer supports opening a file with the specified default editor. When the file is edited, you can choose whether to upload the file automatically.

Open With Default Editor

entry.title: WindTerm - Transfer / Sftp / Keyboard Shortcuts
entry.content:
Quick Start

Shortcut Action
F2 Rename
F3 Download
F4 Upload
F5 Refresh
F6 Move to
Del Remove
Return Open
Backspace Cdup
Alt+D Select the address bar
Alt+Left Go backward
Alt+Right Go forward
Alt+Return Show property
Ctrl+A Select all items
Ctrl+Shift+N Create a folder
Ctrl+N Create a file
Ctrl+L Create a link
Ctrl+C Copy names
Ctrl+Shift+C Copy paths
Ctrl+P Copy names to terminal
Ctrl+Shift+P Copy paths to terminal

entry.title: WindTerm - Performance
entry.content:
Quick Start

WindTerm has extremely high performance and low memory consumption.

Performance

Example: time seq 1 1000000 (Modify putty config “Lines of scrollback” to 1200000)

WindTerm Putty
elapsed 1.333s 8.098s
memory (before) 20.7MB 3.4MB
memory (after) 25.7MB 463.0MB
